summary: The West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2025 aims to permanently prohibit oil and gas exploration, development, and production on the Outer Continental Shelf off the coasts of California, Oregon, and Washington. It amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to specify that the Secretary of the Interior cannot issue leases or authorizations for such activities within designated planning areas. The bill references the 2024-2029 National Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Gas Leasing Proposed Final Program.
